name: TheAtlantic
text: Kamala Harris is Joe Biden’s pick for vice president. In July, @IsaacDovere wrote that if she were the pick, it would “probably seem like the longest, most drawn-out lead-up to an obvious conclusion in the history of modern presidential politics.” https://t.co/uNH8S3x2ir

name: TheAtlantic
text: Joe Biden’s running mate, Kamala Harris, is two decades younger than him—the potential vice presidency seems like merely a first step, @IsaacDovere writes. https://t.co/ffRHzdJlRk

name: TheAtlantic
text: Pop culture can’t imagine a female vice president like Kamala Harris, @megangarber argues: https://t.co/LmH3xE5uSH

name: TheAtlantic
text: At the height of its popularity, in 2012, Anonymous had been a network of thousands of activists, but it had since largely faded from view. But now Anonymous is back, with a new generation eager to join, @DaleBeran writes. https://t.co/PE4rmeOxXJ

name: TheAtlantic
text: "If Republicans wanted to limit voter turnout and raise doubts about the election’s integrity, creating chaos within the Postal Service and undermining its independence would be an efficient way to pursue that goal," Winifred Gallagher writes: https://t.co/5gIK1r9fuA

name: TheAtlantic
text: Kamala Harris will be waging her vice-presidential campaign within a culture that is happy to allow women their place—as long as they know their place. @megangarber writes: https://t.co/DyU54I3hFW

name: TheAtlantic
text: Kamala Harris is officially the Democratic vice-presidential candidate. @PeterBeinart writes that Harris’s tough-on-crime record says “less about her than about the country in which she lived.”  https://t.co/7cywMBiaBU

name: TheAtlantic
text: As the co-founder of an NYC tutoring company, @bplatzer has been fielding calls every day from desperate parents struggling to figure out how to help their kids this school year and wondering whether they should set up a pod. This is what he tells them: https://t.co/g1Zg1Jtg24

name: TheAtlantic
text: "It is a bit disorienting to wake up early expecting to go out for a walk, and find that you have been personally targeted for sanctions by the most powerful authoritarian state in the world," @abramowitz writes: https://t.co/riKQdKc66d

name: TheAtlantic
text: Twenty years after her moment in the Hollywood spotlight, @amandafortini writes, the famed environmental activist Erin Brockovich has not slowed down. https://t.co/okT4XFaYLM

name: TheAtlantic
text: Teachers discuss whether it’s safe to reopen schools this fall, via @TheAtlLetters: https://t.co/57BdBUVJ2u

name: TheAtlantic
text: Fever checks are being widely ordered as schools and offices reopen. But passing them shouldn't be taken as evidence that you're not spreading the virus, writes @jameshamblin. https://t.co/3WuP62TqfK

name: TheAtlantic
text: Is Mars overstudied? No, but plenty of other planets (and moons) in our solar system are also worthy of attention, @marinakoren writes. https://t.co/uOiwjQvwDq

name: TheAtlantic
text: "All these lights started going off." @arielsabar talks with @amyweissmeyer about the stranger-than-fiction story of a Harvard professor, a con artist, and a papyrus fragment that made front-page news: https://t.co/5OU7EQ8xJy

name: TheAtlantic
text: "All these lights started going off." @arielsabar talks with @amyweissmeyer about the stranger-than-fiction story of a Harvard professor, a con artist, and a papyrus fragment that made front-page news: https://t.co/rzS18SKln0

name: TheAtlantic
text: "To get ahead in Trump’s Washington, the lesson for other countries’ leaders and diplomats is clear: You need to have something to sell and the connections to sell it." @tommctague and @peteratlantic report: https://t.co/ODbAkWtWyz

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Millennials are the incarceration generation," argues @JillFilipovic. "From cradle through childhood to parenthood and near middle age, Millennial lives have been shaped and stymied by policing and prisons." https://t.co/bHMWZSJ5eJ

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Millennials are the incarceration generation," argues @JillFilipovic. "From cradle through childhood to parenthood and near middle age, Millennial lives have been shaped and stymied by policing and prisons." https://t.co/DZC4IUYsJQ

name: TheAtlantic
text: From ‘Air Force One’ to ‘Veep,’ Hollywood’s imagination is narrow when it comes to women in political power, @megangarber writes: https://t.co/yTEAHnnDFb

name: TheAtlantic
text: What might the office of the vice president look like under Kamala Harris? What does her nomination foretell about her party? Our writers weigh in. The latest Atlantic Daily: https://t.co/0fQJzkfzAk

name: TheAtlantic
text: “We have seen nothing like this at Arecibo before.” A famous observatory in Puerto Rico is out of commission after a fallen cable wrecked part of its telescope dish, Marina Koren reports. https://t.co/xEGowh5OeY

name: TheAtlantic
text: It's common for people in middle age to feel spiritual stirrings, even if they've been nonreligious for some time. @arthurbrooks writes that this change in identity can be scary—but with faith or anything else, it's healthy to let ourselves change: https://t.co/D75liXkDyv

name: TheAtlantic
text: Jared Kushner's management of the U.S. pandemic relief was a spectacular failure for one key reason, @FranklinFoer writes. “In the end, what he lacked wasn’t competence, but the courage to challenge his father-in-law’s fantasies.” https://t.co/9gPcRVaLYR

name: TheAtlantic
text: Satirizing capitalism is nothing new. But amid a pandemic that has revealed the brutal calculus of “essential work,” fiction that grimly skewers corporate exploitation carries new resonance. @madelesque writes: https://t.co/lU09S4aUTU

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @SStossel: "This is the essence of Jared Kushner’s legacy: the gap between his adamant faith in his own good intentions and the grim reality of the administration he helps run." https://t.co/IZ5LCBbVJB

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @JeffreyGoldberg: "Like many Americans, I’ve been watching Kushner for four years now, and I’ve asked myself this question: Why does he enable his father-in-law’s worst impulses?" -- @FranklinFoer, with the definitive portrait of Jared:
https://t.co/QZcn95bZI5

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @AdrienneLaF: This is a story about propulsive ambition, boundless self-abasement, and filial devotion. It’s also a masterclass in corruption. Just-published @FranklinFoer on Jared Kushner: https://t.co/Igw7YwetP7

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @FranklinFoer: After developing plans for containing COVID, Kushner began mouthing his fathers delusions. In April, he started blaming Democratic governors for hyping the virus and washed his hands of the problem. “I’m done,” he told one outside advisor.  https://t.co/Gsj11uudXJ

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @FranklinFoer: This is my reported study of Jared Kushner’s relationship with Trump—a father-son saga that defines our times. It’s a profile of cowardice.  https://t.co/Gsj11uudXJ

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @JaBogen: "This dangerous admixture of propulsive ambition and boundless self-abasement has now come to afflict the nation. Kushner’s foibles have exacerbated the administration’s disastrous response to its greatest crisis." 

Always read @FranklinFoer: https://t.co/eVcFtsW2Ds

name: TheAtlantic
text: Rather than a moderating presence in the White House, Jared Kushner has often served as Trump's most dangerous enabler. "It’s a role that he thrives at playing, because he’s spent his whole life rehearsing for it," @FranklinFoer writes. https://t.co/BKqDisWKtK

name: TheAtlantic
text: President Trump has opposed increased funding for the USPS, citing that the money would be used to facilitate mail-in voting in November. Winifred Gallagher explains the danger of politicizing the postal service: https://t.co/z6xoN0ntJ1

name: TheAtlantic
text: By slowing mail delivery, and the receipt of mail-in ballots, President Trump is attempting to cast doubt on the outcome of November’s election, @tribelaw, @jentaub, and @jgeltzer write: https://t.co/VWeXb1cRQj

name: TheAtlantic
text: Today at 2pm ET, editor in chief @Jeffrey Goldberg will interview staff writer @EdYong209 on his new cover story, "How the Pandemic Defeated America." https://t.co/ZKhUt6mdmr

name: TheAtlantic
text:
Polished, soft-spoken, and a self-styled moderate, Jared Kushner has become his father-in-law’s most dangerous enabler, writes @FranklinFoer.
https://t.co/a9Aj5zJWhc

name: TheAtlantic
text: A woman vice-presidential candidate is both historic and painful for young feminists, @emmaogreen writes. https://t.co/XVVGbj6eqF
